snippet: Planes and ships from a half-dozen countries joined the search for the plane that vanished with 239 people, including two who apparently used stolen passports to board.
abstract: Questions multiply more than 48 hours after disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370, as crews from a half-dozen countries continue to search for plane's wreckage; Malaysian officials have refused to release many details of case, adding to the misery of family members left behind; authorities have not ruled out terrorism, though no group has claimed responsibility, nor has electronic surveillance picked up chatter about case.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Chris Buckley and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong; Edward Wong and Andrew Jacobs from Beijing; Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok; and Eric Schmitt and Matthew L. Wald from Washington. Bree Feng, Mia Li and Amy Qin contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Planes and ships from a half-dozen countries joined the search for the plane that vanished with 239 people, including two who apparently used stolen passports to board.

headline.main: Search for Jet Compounds the Mystery
headline.print_headline: Search for Jet Compounds the Mystery
